programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May build their own stretch limousines out of other vehicles and use them to transport celebrities to the Brit Awards. Meanwhile, a Ford Mustang is put through its paces, and actress Billie Piper is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Aussie Pickers
programme.desc: Series following two pickers, Lucas Callaghan and Adam McDonald, who earn a living by restoring forgotten relics to their former glory, beginning with a visit to a junkyard.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.sub-title: May The Ford Be with You
programme.desc: Mike and Frank attempt to unearth a rare vintage car, which could be worth a fortune.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: A Maine homestead reveals six generations of secrets, and NASCAR driver Ryan Newman proves that when it comes to negotiating, he is just as tough as Danielle.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Ione gives Barry and Darren the run-around in Lincolnshire as host Sean Kelly reveals the hidden gems of more storage lockers.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Host Sean Kelly returns to Birmingham, where Heavy D and Sam team up to combine their clout and cash, one of which they seem rather short of.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the hunters are off to Leeds, where a new pair of bidders arrive - and they are not afraid to throw their weight around. Meanwhile, Sam and Ione re-ignite their feud.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders looking for treasures in Ipswich. With Heavy D back in town the bargaining buccaneers are being driven mad by the booming bidder.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie Hall, winner of the 2017 World's Strongest Man contest, tours the USA on a quest to conquer the biggest and best eye-watering food and physical challenges. Eddie lands in Florida Keys to attempt a conch-fritter eating record, do some serious big-game fishing and try what's billed as the best Key Lime Pie on earth.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie Hall squares up to the Mac & Cheese Challenge at Brooklyn's Mac Shack - which weighs in at more than two kilograms and nearly 7,000 calories of pasta, cheese and sauce.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Suspicions are raised when a routine x-ray reveals suspicious packages hidden inside the tyres of a pick-up truck. Officers also seize a large shipment of marijuana.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters try to impress Oxford residents by building an electric car, and refuse to let an unenthusiastic response deter them from sitting in on the machine's crash-test before handing it over to the Stig's environmentally friendly cousin. Actor Michael Sheen is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car, and Jeremy Clarkson pits the Corvette ZR1 against the Audi R8 V10

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond debate which company has made the greatest number of exceptional vehicles, and James May finds a way of transporting caravans to campsites without inconveniencing other road users. The Top Gear track plays host to a replica of one of the world's most famous rally cars, and broadcaster Chris Evans - some five years before he was announced as the show's new presenter - is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites another three celebrities to reveal their pet hates in the hope he will banish them to Room 101. Chef Heston Blumenthal hates it when people put milk in their tea first, Newsnight presenter Kirsty Wark is put off by men who wear too much aftershave and stand-up comedian James Acaster hates geese.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Former Happy Mondays frontman Shaun Ryder, comedian and actress Meera Syal and Australian stand-up Sam Simmons tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. The celebrities' gripes include football talk, boisterous whistling and severe makeover shows.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Strictly host Claudia Winkleman, broadcaster John Humphrys and comedian Russell Kane tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. The celebrities' gripes include skiing, summer, whooping in audiences and fussy eaters.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Comedian and actress Bridget Christie, political correspondent Robert Peston and DJ Greg James tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. Their gripes include honeymoons, over-attentive waiters and The Kardashians.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy takes the kids away to her parents while Lee stays in the house to oversee the building work being done their kitchen, but unfortunately the tradesman he has employed has an annoyingly relaxed attitude to deadlines. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: As Lee Mack brings the popular sitcom to an end, a chance to see some of the unintentionally comic moments during filming that ended up on the cutting-room floor.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Guests Angela Barnes, Rob Beckett, Ed Byrne, Milton Jones and Miles Jupp join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Rob Beckett, Gary Delaney, Ed Gamble, Rhys James and Zoe Lyons join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation. First shown in July 2016.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Terms and Conditions Apply
programme.desc: Using his trademark, powerpoint-comedy and mischievous games, Dave invites Rose Matafeo, Phil Wang and Marcus Brigstocke to help him make sense of our insensible world.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Actor Danny Dyer takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from November 2018, with comedian Sara Pascoe and tennis coach Judy Murray joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A colossal American football stadium in Texas, that features the world's largest retractable roof and is able to seat over 100,000 spectators with no restricted viewpoints.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Account of Operation Barbarossa, Germany's plan to invade the Soviet Union in 1941, revealing the massive human and financial cost endured by the Soviet people, who fought a bloody and lonely war with little support from the Allies. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on another expedition through some of Britain's most historic landscapes. He begins with a towpath exploration of industrial engineering along the Leeds and Liverpool Canal. Setting off from Liverpool, he takes a three-day walk inland to Wigan, ending at the town's iconic pier as he traces the story of the waterway's chaotic construction and its impact on the development of Lancashire.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson travels along the north Norfolk coast through one of the least developed spots in Britain, finding out how the area maintained its rural, remote identity despite the dynamic industrial changes of the Victorian age. From the arrival of Bertie, Prince of Wales at Sandringham House to the opening of Cromer Pier, Tony's four-day walk sees him learn about key periods in the county's history. He explores prime shooting estates, purpose-built seaside resorts, salt marshes and disused railway lines as he discovers how powerful landowners were able to control development and even shape the railways to suit their needs.

programme.title: The First Silent Night
programme.desc: Simon Callow discovers the origin of the Christmas carol and the story of the two Austrians who wrote it.

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Who Put Bella in the Wych Elm
programme.desc: The dark tale of the skeleton of an unknown woman found in a hollowed-out tree in Birmingham woodland, exploring the links between the woman and Nazi spy rings operating in Britain.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Zak and Alex face a four-day mission to deliver a pair of classic steam locomotives for an Autumn Steam Gala at the Mid Hants Railway in Hampshire.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek collects a Jaguar Mark 2 and explains why they made such poor getaway cars for 1960s bank robbers. A customer considers a Morris Marina as a Christmas present for his wife.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team is under pressure with a record number of cars to auction, but Derek finds room for one more - a replica AC Cobra. A couple are reunited with their Volvo breakdown truck.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A classic car fan with a love of the Jaguar E-Type reluctantly sends his dream car to auction, hoping to buy a motorhome with the money. Two Ford Escorts get Dave's pulse racing.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: An exploration of the effects of the eruption of volcanos in the ocean. From these violent beginnings emerge islands and coral reefs that are home to a vast array of wildlife, including giant manta rays and vampire bugs that thrive in the tropical snow, after a process that takes millions of years. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: The struggle for survival on the region's isolated islands, home to flightless parrots, burrowing bats, giant skinks and tree-dwelling kangaroos. The documentary reveals how the arrival of new species can upset the delicate natural balance, with disastrous consequences, and explores the human history of the region. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: Efforts to preserve the marine life of the region, which is home to the world's richest coral reefs and an array of species, including whales, sharks, albatross and tuna. Despite millions of people relying on its fish stocks, the seas have very little protection and face various threats, with international fishing fleets taking a disastrous toll. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: An exploration of the effects of the eruption of volcanos in the ocean. From these violent beginnings emerge islands and coral reefs that are home to a vast array of wildlife, including giant manta rays and vampire bugs that thrive in the tropical snow, after a process that takes millions of years. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: The struggle for survival on the region's isolated islands, home to flightless parrots, burrowing bats, giant skinks and tree-dwelling kangaroos. The documentary reveals how the arrival of new species can upset the delicate natural balance, with disastrous consequences, and explores the human history of the region. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: Efforts to preserve the marine life of the region, which is home to the world's richest coral reefs and an array of species, including whales, sharks, albatross and tuna. Despite millions of people relying on its fish stocks, the seas have very little protection and face various threats, with international fishing fleets taking a disastrous toll. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.

programme.title: TOTP2
programme.desc: Another selection of performances from the archive, focusing on hits of the 1960s. The programme features Lulu, the Kinks, the Walker Brothers and Don Partridge.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Recalling a decade in British music, with archive performances from the early stages of the 'swingin' era, featuring music by by rock, pop and R'n'B artists including the Springfields, the Shadows, the Beatles and the Rolling Stones.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: More pop, rock and rhythm and blues from the archives, featuring appearances by the Rolling Stones, the Dave Clark Five, the Seekers and the Byrds from 1964 and '65.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: A selection of archive footage from the arrival of the so-called beat boom in 1964, which catered to the art-school craze for rhythm and blues. Featuring performances by Tom Jones, the Kinks, Manfred Mann, the Rolling Stones, John Lee Hooker and the Pretty Things.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris takes a railway trip across Canada, revealing how 2,500 miles of transcontinental railway was built against huge odds in just a few decades, helping to join together a vast wilderness of isolated communities and create the country that exists today. He begins his journey on one of the earliest sections of track to be built, on a train that is now a lifeline for hunters and fishermen. He then sees one of the biggest, most famous trains in the world - the Canadian, before heading for the Prairies, and on to the port of Vancouver. Along the way he also searches for Winnie the Pooh, crosses raging rivers and meets the descendant of a pioneering Yorkshire family who arrived here more than 100 years ago.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A formerly luxurious and strategic mountain-top villa on the island of Rhodes in the Mediterranean that's been ravaged by acts of revenge by locals since 1955.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Kevin Norris and Kieran Chisnall move three state-of-the-art trains, fresh in from Japan. They need to transport them from the North East port of Redcar to a factory in Doncaster.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Stratolaunch is designed to lift rockets, spacecraft and experimental high-speed hypersonic planes into the stratosphere, then release them for their onward journey into space.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Old adversary Linda Cummings taunts Boyd from inside a secure psychiatric hospital, leading the team to discover more murder victims within its confines. As his frustrations rise, Boyd needs help from Grace - but she has been mysteriously forced to take time away from the Cold Case Squad and handed the investigation over to an eminent psychologist who is an expert on Cummings. Guest starring Gina McKee, Ruth Gemmell and Alexander Siddiq.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jack takes over as superintendent in Adam's absence, and promotes Neil Manson to acting DCI - despite grave misgivings about his recent conduct. Gabriel publicly asks Sheelagh out for dinner, allaying her fears that their relationship is over, and Ramani is devastated to learn Terry has been having an affair with his sister-in-law. Affairs of the heart also preoccupy Dan Casper, who receives another poison pen letter - but decides to ignore it and continue his affair with Rochelle.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A grieving Nick struggles to come to terms with Ariadne's tragic death, while a raging timber-yard fire has serious consequences for Billy.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the stunning Rowden Gardens on Dartmoor - one of the participants in the National Gardens Scheme.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: A distraught Dr Napier berates herself for failing to diagnose a case of diphtheria, while Dr Cameron shoulders the melancholy task of attending an old friend who is hovering at death's door. Drama, starring David Rintoul.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: The medic temporarily hangs up his stethoscope to intervene in a confrontation between Irish farm labourers and irate locals who blame them for a typhus outbreak, resolving matters with a combination of tough talking and common sense. David Rintoul stars, with Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A virtuoso violinist baffles Lovejoy by asking him to help pull off an elaborate con involving a fake Stradivarius - so he enlists an expert to find out what is going on. Whimsical drama, starring Ian McShane.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Snooker player Dennis Taylor asks Lovejoy for help finding a billiards table that once belonged to Mary Queen of Scots. Drama, also starring Ian McShane.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Richard Sharpe becomes a pawn in a French plan to retain control of Spain, and finds himself facing execution for murder. Determined to regain his honour, he undertakes a dangerous quest to find the only person capable of clearing his name. Adaptation of Bernard Cornwell's novel, starring Sean Bean.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: The lads return to work on an ambitious engineering project, with new member Wyman filling in for his late, lamented dad Wayne. Reunited by Oz, who has secured the job of dismantling the world-famous Middlesbrough transporter bridge, they set about raising the necessary financial backing - but have a hard time persuading Dennis to join them. Dick Clement and Ian La Frenais' popular comedy drama, starring Jimmy Nail, Kevin Whately and Tim Healy.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: The lads begin work on dismantling the historic Transporter Bridge, but tension between the Serbian and Kosovan workers soon starts slowing things down - and worries about Bomber's health add to their woes. Elsewhere, Mickey Startup dispatches hitman Teddy Platt to teach Moxey the error of his ways, while Oz has an eye-opening reunion with son Rod. Dick Clement and Ian La Frenais's popular comic drama, starring Tim Healy, Kevin Whately, Timothy Spall and Jimmy Nail.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Rosemary's old school friend Dorothy invites the duo to restore the gardens of her beautiful villa on the French Riviera so the property can be opened to the public. The plan arouses bitter hostility among the neighbours and long-held family secrets start to surface, leading to murder. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are hired to investigate why newly planted roses at an upmarket preparatory school keep dying. After witnessing the arcane ritual of the Night of the Stag, they detect tensions between modernising headmaster Quentin Marshall and established members of his staff who are harbouring secrets someone is prepared to kill for. Drama, guest starring Anthony Andrews (Brideshead Revisited), with Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The green-fingered sleuths are hired to work behind the scenes of a garden makeover TV show, but Rosemary has an accident while standing in for the programme's star and ends up in hospital. Realising someone is trying to sabotage the series, Laura teams up with no-nonsense presenter Quinnie Dorell (Belinda Lang) to catch the culprit. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Philip Henderson is found dead in his field following an altercation the previous day with his neighbour Doug Randall about his failed crop. Suspicion falls on the neighbour and his new wife, who was known to have had ongoing problems with Philip over his unpaid bar tab at her pub. However, as Mike and the team dig further into the mystery more suspects come into play. Neill Rea stars.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: When a man is electrocuted during a typing contest with Crabtree and Louise Cherry, Murdoch suspects the reporter was the intended target.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: The death of a policeman in a Soho strip club introduces Gene and the team to their new boss, detective 'Super Mac'. After months of silence, Alex again starts receiving flashes from the present - as well as the attentions of a mysterious admirer - while Chris tries to impress Shaz with his credentials as a new man. Philip Glenister and Keeley Hawes star.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: A car chase ends with a fatal crash, and Gene is accused of causing death by dangerous driving, leading to increased tension with the local community. As Alex takes up the fight to prove her boss's innocence, she becomes concerned that he is being led into corruption by Super Mac - and to add to her problems, she begins to doubt her mysterious stalker's offer of a way home.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: Former colleague Julia Piper asks Kavanagh if he will fly out to the States and help her fight the appeal of a convicted murderer on death row. Once in the Land of the Free, he finds himself up against a governor determined to ensure sentence is carried out - and realises that where justice is concerned, the Americans sometimes just do not play cricket. Legal drama, starring John Thaw, Anna Chancellor and Lisa Harrow.

programme.title: Sky News @ Breakfast
programme.desc: Join Stephen Dixon and Gillian Joseph for all the news from home and abroad, the latest sport and weather, and a review of the weekend papers.

programme.title: Sky News @ Breakfast
programme.desc: Join Stephen Dixon and Gillian Joseph for all the news from home and abroad, the latest sport and weather, and a review of the weekend papers.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Mission Employable
programme.desc: Agent Danny visits the Stadium of Light where he gets the chance to train with the ladies' team at Sunderland AFC.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz and Weasel set up their super-antenna in the desert. Magoo ends up beside them. He mistakes the antenna for a forest's last oak tree..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Hidden inside a robot, Fizz and Weasel hack the world's Internet server, but Magoo, shopping the sales, mistakes it for a shopping cart and takes it..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz is recording chill music to de-stress the world, so he needs quiet. Unluckily, Magoo's come over to borrow a wrench and thinks there's a leak..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean is forced to baby-sit Mrs. Wicket's Nephew on an Outward Bound day course..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The hapless buffoon heads out on a camping trip, but his knowledge of wild animals proves less than worthy.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: At Biggie Box Japan, Ben waits in an epic line for the release of the latest Sumo Slammers video game, Cyber Slammers.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave is given a bulb to grow. Popping it in his lunch box, it isn't long before he discovers it's partial to Betty's sandwiches..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: George adapts the spin cycle of the washing machine causing a black hole to form in the Spuds' kitchen..

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: Highlights from past episodes, including recipes from chefs Parveen Ashraf, Shaun Hill, Richard Bertinet and Francesco Mazzei, and James taking a trip to Snowdonia and making lunch for Jane Seymour. Plus, James prepares spiced lamb, cookies and the ultimate ham and cheese sandwich and cooks lunch for Jane Seymour.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: The chef is joined by Brian Turner to explore the culinary delights of his native Yorkshire, with James visiting Frances Atkins' restaurant The Yorke Arms, where he enjoys her signature dish al fresco in her unusual dining room the Onion. Brian tastes the delights of some local charcuterie and is challenged to some off-road driving, while James brushes up his clay-pigeon shooting skills.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott's culinary tour reaches North Africa and the Moroccan city of Marrakesh. He visits a restaurant famous for cooking whole lambs in an underground oven, has a masterclass from local chef Cedric, who shows him how to make traditional food with a fancy twist, and hits the main square for some street food. Throughout the show he prepares flat breads with tomato salsa, barbecue corn on the cob with local spice spicy ras el hanout and whole fish with chermoula.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: DCI Tom Barnaby reluctantly joins wife Joyce on a spa weekend at Swavely Manor, a country house offering treatments to soothe the mind and body. However, as he attempts to unwind, a woman is found dead in a flotation chamber and he promptly abandons his therapy to investigate - but the body count soon rises. The detective eventually wraps up the case, but it proves to be his last as he makes a big decision about his future. John Nettles' final appearance in the long-running series, with guest stars Ronni Ancona, Geraldine James and Lesley Manville.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard invites comedian Joel Dommett, reality star Lydia Bright and actress Sarah Hadland to take part in a special edition of the quiz show, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the 20,000 prize for their selected charity.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Katherine Ryan, George Shelley, Faye Brookes and Bobby Davro pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge, hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Members of the public compete alongside celebrities Rickie Williams, Melvin Odoom and Laura Crane, and those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: In this edition, Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show from York, setting members of the public unusual challenges for a chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to 1,000 in the big finale game.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the 14th series of nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win 250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams are once again on hand to judge this week's applicants, and each of them has the chance to put their favourite contestant straight through to the live semi-finals by awarding them the Golden Buzzer.

programme.title: Through the Keyhole
programme.desc: Radio DJ and TV presenter Marvin Humes, Good Morning Britain's Kate Garraway, and comedian Jimmy Carr form the panel this time, as Keith Lemon is given another chance to rummage around the homes of three more mystery celebrities. As he tours the home, he points out items and features that might offer clues to the owners' identity, and challenges the studio panel to come up with the right answer to the question, 'who habitates in a house like this?'.

programme.title: The Departed (2006)
programme.desc: A cop infiltrates the inner circle of a feared Boston mobster, unaware a fellow officer is already an informant on the gangster's payroll. When both the crooks and the police discover they have a mole in their ranks, the two detectives realise they are in sudden danger and try to expose each other. Martin Scorsese's Oscar-winning thriller, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Matt Damon, Jack Nicholson, Mark Wahlberg, Martin Sheen and Alec Baldwin.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. The beach buggy project is completed and Edd China takes it for a test drive before Mike Brewer tries to sell it on for a profit.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Eccentric military equipment collector Bruce Crompton heads to a Martello Tower on the Channel Islands. Meanwhile, the twins are tasked to get a Second World War Napalm filled flamethrower ready for a buyer.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Part one of two. Paul Jr's decision to put Odie in charge of the Bling Star bike backfires when he misses the deadline. Meanwhile, Mikey suggests the Teutels attend family therapy.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Mike Kennedy goes underwater in Florida to seize a seaplane, while Ken Cage and Danny Thompson chase a debtor who has been fooling them with phony flight plans.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe discovers how much manual labour it takes to make rum, as he scours copper, carries molasses and hauls hoses at a distillery.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: A look at how customised knee replacements, leaf springs and lavender oil are made.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Cast Iron Stoves/Ultralight Aircraft/Snow Groomers/Rubber Bands
programme.desc: The development of manufacturing processes behind cast Iron stoves, ultralight aircraft, snow groomers and rubber bands.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Captain Jake Anderson has a shot at redemption after deliberately defying Sig, and the fleet battles against mental and physical breakdown late into the Opilio season.

programme.title: Devonport: Inside the Royal Navy
programme.desc: Life on board HMS Ocean. While preparing for the biggest Nato exercise in years, the crew gets a secret visit from a VIP.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys a Ford Mustang Fastback and gives it to mechanic Edd China to restore, as the duo hope to turn the wreck into a machine worth more than 20,000

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tries to get his hands on one of his dad's favourites - a Ford Popular, a car known for being variable in its quality.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer lands a Ford Escort Mk1 for 4,500 in an internet auction, and he and Edd China get to work on giving the classic 1970s car a new lease of life with a retro refit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer searches for a 1957 Thunderbird, marketed as one of the world's first luxury cars, which sold healthily in its day.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: A pickup truck is a stateside icon and Mike Brewer is keen to get into the booming classic truck market. He manages to find a 1950s Ford F-1, which is an unfinished project. mechanic Edd China creates a paint scheme based on a 'sandstorm in the desert'.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer combines his love of vintage Escorts and rallying by making a Ford rally car, and it is left to Edd China to try to make a profit on such an expensive build.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China decide the classic 1980s muscle car, the Ford Mustang GT, is the ideal, affordable vehicle for an aspiring mechanic to start working on.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer gets his hands on a valuable 1995 Ford Escort RS Cosworth, hoping new mechanic Ant Anstead can restore the 227hp engine's famous 'fizz'.

programme.title: Swimming with Monsters with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: The naturalist tries to swim with Africa's most dangerous animal, the hippopotamus, in an attempt to study its secret underwater behaviour.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Tunnel Rats face an unexploded bomb and deadly gasses. The Bros attempt to rescue their season, and rookie team The Poms go underground for the first time.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Ant Anstead enter the market for iconic American SUVs with a 1988 Jeep Grand Wagoneer. However, the vehicle has sagging suspension and defective four-wheel drive.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and Paul Cowland head to Kent to look at a glamorous Sunbeam Alpine roadster. With the classic car in demand, Paul is sure it's a smart buy, but Drew needs some convincing.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: A hunt for fresh stock takes Drew Pritchard to the Cotswolds, where he finds a giant stash of Indian and Afghan treasures which have come directly from the subcontinent.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Gramophone guru Tim Weeks takes on the restoration of a huge early 20th-century record player and radio. Jay Blades and the team also repair a broken pipe and a huge blue ceramic pitcher that is missing several pieces.

programme.title: World's Greatest Motorcycle Rides
programme.desc: The most famous road race in the world - the Isle of Man TT, which follows a course only 37 miles long.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Tunnel Rats face an unexploded bomb and deadly gasses. The Bros attempt to rescue their season, and rookie team The Poms go underground for the first time.

programme.title: Jungle Gold
programme.desc: Struggling property experts George Wright and Scott Lomu hope a mining expedition in the jungles of Ghana will provide them with enough gold to secure their families' futures.

programme.title: Dr G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A crime alerted to police by a trucker who reported a woman's battered body by a road. It fell to Dr G to identify her killer. Plus, the investigation into a suspicious drowning.

programme.title: Dr G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: The doctor tries to piece together the evidence that will determine exactly what happened in her patient's final minutes.

programme.title: Dr G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Medical examiner Dr Jan Garavaglia tries to piece together the evidence that will determine exactly what happened in a person's final minutes.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: When no murder weapon is found, FBI agents resort to working undercover to investigate a woman's disappearance.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Sage Halford seizes pit bulls that were allegedly used for fighting, and goes on to tackle their owner in court.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Archie the Labrador suffers life-threatening shakes, a canine gets a fishing hook stuck in its mouth, a snake takes a dip in an old woman's pool and a walleroo requires help.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Davone arrives with high expectations, former cheerleader Carrie seeks the right dress, having returned a previous purchase, and military bride Jennifer has her first fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A would-be-bride tries to find dresses that will fit her voluptuous bridesmaids, while another battles with her sister, who is determined to wear a tiara to the wedding.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride faces a power struggle with her sister over the colour of the bridesmaids' dresses, while another makes big plans for a memorable second trip down the aisle.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: The Big Day
programme.desc: The story of Amanda, a self-proclaimed 'daddy's girl' who has a huge budget for her wedding and will stop at nothing to get exactly what she wants.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: The Big Day
programme.desc: Sheena realises her mother has hijacked her dream Indian wedding, leading to clashes over how to spend her unlimited budget.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Following the fortunes of talented musician and singer Brandon, whose addiction to food has left him incapacitated. He now risks losing his girlfriend and his career dreams.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: A grieving mother has gastric bypass surgery to reduce her weight, but now has to confront the emotional issues that cause her to overeat.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Gideon, who weighs 650lbs, is desperate to address his problem, so uproots his family to restart his life with weight-loss surgery and hopes for a happier future.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. A woman who has spent 10 years in bed turns to a doctor for help with losing weight, but may have left it too late to change.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Nicole shops with the help of her psychic aunt, Desiree consults her 90-year-old grandmother and Allyson tries to match a century-old veil with a modern dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Randi is having a carnival wedding and wants a polka-dot gown, while opera singer Mary seeks a dress to match her personality.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Nicole leaves her young quadruplets at home as she shops, while cancer patient Margo wants a dress that will give her a boost.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Heather looks for a dramatic gown that complements her hips, while body-conscious Kristyn finally drops by, having avoided wedding dress shopping for a year.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Shari looks for a vow renewal dress with her fussy husband, Alex must find a gown in 24 hours and Ebony feels nervous about her fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Kandice travels from Texas to find a striking dress for her vow renewal, while Barbara wants a sexy gown with sparkle to match her stilettos.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Violet wants a tight-fitting gown to wear at her Dominican Republic wedding, fussy Rachel hopes Kleinfeld's will be her last stop and Leighann has high standards.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: Requests Like None of the Rest
programme.desc: Amanda searches for something with sparkles and glitter, Charae wants a 1980s dress and Lynsey opts for a short party look.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo claims she can speak to the dead, as she connects clients with their loved ones.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo surprises unsuspecting people at a hotel and a dentist's office. Later, she surprises the kidney donor who saved her friend's life after seeing the show.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: Since her mother's death, Anne's hoarding has become obsessive, and her son is now mimicking her odd behaviour.

programme.title: Evil Online
programme.desc: The case of Lacey, a young mother, who turned to the internet for help when her young son became unwell. When the boy's condition worsened, the police suspected foul play.

programme.title: I Survived Evil
programme.desc: Charisma Carpenter investigates how a Texas woman attempted to turn the tables on her captor in order to save herself and her three daughters.

programme.title: Serial Psyche
programme.desc: Experts and investigators examine the backgrounds of the world's most notorious serial killers to create a cognitive psychological profile and find out what made them kill.

programme.title: The Killer in My Family
programme.desc: Relatives of the Genesee River serial killer, Arthur Hutchinson, reveal how his heinous crimes impacted the family. Were there any signs of murderous intentions?.
